docs.snippet: Mrs. Dorothy Andrus of Stamford, Conn., only American woman entrant, won her first match in the French hard-court tennis championships today and Don Budge and Gene Mako, United States Davis Cup players, advanced in doubles without playing as the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Dorothy Andrus of Stamford, Conn., only American woman entrant, won her first match in the French hard-court tennis championships today and Don Budge and Gene Mako, United States Davis Cup players, advanced in doubles without playing as the second round was completed.

headline.main: MRS. ANDRUS GAINS IN FRENCH TENNIS; Budge-Mako Win by Default--Miss Marble Beats Mile. Jedrzejowska in England
SHIPPING AND MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN DAYLIGHT-SAVING TIME

docs.snippet: Danger of war in two areas on the South American Continent was seen this week-end. Peru and Ecuador furnished one critical situation and at the same time the unhealed wound left by the Chaco war between Bolivia and Paraguay was again opened.
docs.lead_paragraph: Danger of war in two areas on the South American Continent was seen this week-end. Peru and Ecuador furnished one critical situation and at the same time the unhealed wound left by the Chaco war between Bolivia and Paraguay was again opened.
docs.abstract: Ecuador mil Cabinet quits; further hostilities; Peru replies to protest; Ecuadorians demonstrate against Peru's Min; Peru explains strengthening border forces; U S Under Sec Welles optimistic

headline.main: TWO WARS FEARED IN SOUTH AMERICA; Ecuador and Peru Mobilize Their Armies as Result of Frontier Clashes

docs.snippet: Having provided two matches for the chess championship of the world, the first of which was won by Dr. Max Euwe of Amsterdam and the second, the return match, by Dr. Alexandre Alekhine of Paris, chess enthusiasts of The Netherlands are preparing more...
docs.lead_paragraph: Having provided two matches for the chess championship of the world, the first of which was won by Dr. Max Euwe of Amsterdam and the second, the return match, by Dr. Alexandre Alekhine of Paris, chess enthusiasts of The Netherlands are preparing more entertainment in the form of an international masters tournament.

headline.main: KERES IS FAVORED IN STRONG FIELD; Tartakower,Spielmann Among Estonian Expert's Rivals in Netherlands Event PLAY TO START TUESDAY Euwe-Capablanca Match Set for Amsterdam--Alekhine Draw Analyzed. Estonian Rival Listed December Match Arranged
